text: Donald L. D. Caspar (born January 8, 1927 â€“ November 27, 2021) was an American structural biologist. He is known for his works on the structures of biological molecules such as tobacco mosaic virus. He was an emeritus professor of biological science at the Institute of Molecular Biophysics, Florida State University, and an emeritus professor of biology at the Rosenstiel Basic Medical Sciences Research Center, Brandeis University. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American biologists
title: Donald Caspar
